meanings.definition: The act of impersonating someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the talent show, Sarah's personations of famous singers were a big hit.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's personations of political figures always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, Tom's personations of movie stars were so convincing!
meanings.sent4: Her personations of different accents were like a master class in vocal mimicry.
meanings.sent5: The actor's personations were so spot-on, it was like watching the real people on stage.

meanings.definition: The portrayal of a character in a play or performance.
meanings.sent1: The school play featured impressive personations of historical figures.
meanings.sent2: In the theater production, the actor's personations of Shakespearean characters were outstanding.
meanings.sent3: The children's personations of animals in the play brought a lot of joy to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her personations of fairy tale characters added a magical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The actor's personations of different roles were so engaging, the audience was captivated throughout the show.
